string.text: You are using Anomaly Magazines. Do not unjam your weapon. Reload your weapon.
Weapon has suffered internal component damage.
Part does not need to be replaced.
%c[d_red]Weapon already has part of better condition.
%c[d_red]Barrels cannot be replaced in the field.
%c[d_red]Weapon is too rusty to take apart in the field.
Enables colorful dialogue on a malfunction.
Adds a timeout to jam profanity if set to 'true'.
Chance for your weapons to jam.
Enables (or disables) those pesky super-jams. Super-jams are jams that require removing the loaded ammunition to properly clean/resolve the issue.
If enabled, on when pressing reload with a super-jammed weapon, the magazine will be ejected for you. No more inventory fumbling!
Weapon condition under which usage has a chance to damage parts. The lower the value, the less that parts will be damaged.
Cost adjustment of technician weapon cleaning.

Verbosity of HUD jamming messages. There are three levels:
 None: Only condition-based jams are alerted (because it is confusing otherwise).
 Normal (recommended): You will be notified when your weapon jams and unjams successfully.
 Full: Everything with 'Normal', but you will also know when you have a severe jam that requires unloading the weapon and unjamming to clear, and when your weapon suffers component damage.
Minimum condition for ALL parts for a weapon to be eligible for sale. If a weapon has ANY part below this condition, it will be blacklisted from sale.\n Set to 0 to disable.
Enables a whole bunch of additional information in the console log.
Disables part-based jams. If you need to tick this, why even have this mod installed at all?

Roll parts with a new formula. The chance of good parts below is adjusted by weapon condition and a further hidden weight. Makes your game harder with low enough weights. To use the old method, disable this.
Rate at which your weapon degrades faster in rainy weather.
This weapon has no parts to remove.

%c[pda_green]QUICK FAQS
 %c[pda_white]Question: Why is my gun jamming at 100%?
 %c[pda_white]Answer: %c[ui_gray_1]Your parts are damaged. Check the condition.
 %c[pda_white]Question: How do I unjam?
 %c[pda_white]Answer: %c[ui_gray_1]Double-tap the '%c[pda_white]USE%c[ui_gray_1]' button. Or '%c[pda_white]right-click%c[ui_gray_1]' the weapon in your inventory to bring up the '%c[pda_white]unjam%c[ui_gray_1]' command.
 %c[pda_white]Question: Why am I losing condition when I replace parts?
 %c[pda_white]Answer: %c[ui_gray_1]You need to lubricate the weapon. This does not happen below a condition of 60%. Use a toolkit to reduce the amount of condition loss or a workbench to eliminate it entirely.
 %c[pda_white]Question: Why don't technicians fix my parts?
 %c[pda_white]Answer: %c[ui_gray_1]Parts must be scavenged. You can buy parts at the technician or use a weapon repair kit. This is the core longevity behind Weapon Parts Overhaul. Weapon Parts Overhaul drastically changes how weapon maintenance works in Anomaly. Read this guide carefully to understand everything.
 
 %c[pda_green]Parts & Maintenance
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1]Your weapon's overall condition (the condition bar) is now easier to maintain. The mechanic will restore this for 60% less cost and all the weapon repair items are far more powerful.
 
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1]Weapon parts need maintenance. You can see the condition of weapon parts on mouse over with the color of the text indicating status: %c[d_red]Missing%c[ui_gray_1], %c[d_orange]Damaged %c[ui_gray_1]and %c[pda_yellow]Dirty%c[ui_gray_1].
 
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1]Weapon parts can be removed by field-stripping the weapon. With this, you may remove every component that is not a barrel. To remove a barrell, you must use a workbench with the correct repair kit.
 
 %c[d_red]ATTENTION
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1]Field-stripping a weapon with a toolkit or workbench will deplete weapon condition if above 60%.
 
 %c[pda_green]Jamming & Part Damage
 %c[pda_white]Parts have five levels of damage:
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[d_red]Broken
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[d_red]Damaged
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[d_orange]Worn
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[0,250,250,0]Dirty
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[d_green]Functional
 %c[ui_gray_1]The more damaged the parts, the higher the chance to suffer a malfunction.
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ Misfire/Jam: %c[ui_gray_1]Can be cleared simply by unjamming.
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ Severe Jam: %c[ui_gray_1]Requires ejection of the magazine before clearing the jam.
 %c[ui_gray_1]Barrels do not contribute to jam chance. However, dirty barrels reduce weapon damage by up to 50%.
 %c[ui_gray_1]Firing a weapon below 85% condition has a chance to deal damage to weapon parts.
 %c[ui_gray_1]Firing a weapon in heavy rain will degrade the weapon faster.
 %c[ui_gray_1]Firing a weapon for too long causes overheating, leading to more jams and faster degradation.
 
 %c[pda_green]Economy Changes
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1]Having a cleaning kit will allow the cleaning of "dirty" weapon parts (above 60% condition). This also restores 10% condition.
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1]Having a repair kit will allow you to replace parts through a 'right-click' menu. This uses a charge and restores 10% condition.
 %c[pda_white]ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1]Technicians will randomly sell weapon parts at a markup.
 %c[ui_gray_1]Weapon parts above 60% can be repaired with Files, Ramrods or Multitools.
 %c[ui_gray_1]Weapon parts above 10% but below 60% can be repaired with a very expensive toolkit available at traders.

Highly advanced toolset including micro-files, cold weld metal epoxy, an electrolysis bath setup and tons of lubricants, petrol distillates and other solvents. However, this kit is extremely hard to put together and is thus sold in very small quantities by Zone technicians.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1] toolkit
 %c[d_orange] ï¿½ %c[ui_gray_1] able to repair weapon parts above 10% but below 60% condition
